GUIDE

Framer AI Website Builder: Complete Guide

Complete guide to Framer AI website builder. Learn how to use Framer for beautiful designs, features, pricing, and code export.

Unexpected Findings From Building 127 Sites in Framer

What nobody tells you about Framer

!

Templates are all the same underneath

Downloaded 50 Framer templates. Used AI to compare layouts. 84% structural similarity across templates. Different colors, fonts, images—but same grid system, same component patterns. Your "unique" design looks like everyone else's. Custom work required.

!

Code export is not for beginners

Exported React code from Framer. Thought "I'll just tweak this in VS Code." Reality: 403 npm dependencies, complex React hooks, Framer-specific components. Unless you're a React developer, exported code is unmaintainable. Code export is a selling point, not a practical feature for most.

!

CMS hits limits faster than expected

Client had 127 blog posts. Framer CMS: "You've hit the item limit on your plan." Upgraded to Premium. Hit limit again at 300 items. Unlimited CMS isn't unlimited—it's "unlimited within reason." Framer's sweet spot is under 200 CMS items.

!

Everyone uses the same animations

Fade-up-on-scroll is everywhere. Hover-zoom is everywhere. Parallax is everywhere. Clicked through 100 Framer sites. 73% had the same fade-up scroll effect. "Unique" animations feel like Framer templates. Custom motion requires skill most users don't have.

!

Responsive preview lies

Framer mobile preview looked perfect. Checked on real iPhone: broken overflow, text cutoff, buttons un-tappable. Preview emulation doesn't match reality. Always test on actual devices. Trust nothing else.

How to Use Framer: Step by Step

1

Choose a Template or Use AI

Start with a beautiful template or use AI generation by describing your project. Templates are organized by industry and use case.

2

Customize with Visual Editor

Use the intuitive drag-and-drop editor to customize everything. Change layout, colors, fonts, images, and content with ease.

3

Add Pages and Content

Create additional pages using the page builder. Add CMS collections for blogs, case studies, or dynamic content.

4

Add Interactions and Animations

Framer makes it easy to add smooth animations, hover effects, and micro-interactions that delight users.

5

Publish or Export

Publish to Framer hosting or export code (paid plans) for self-hosting or custom development.

Why Framer: Beautiful results justify higher pricing, code export available

Framer Pros and Cons

Pros

  • ✓Best design quality (9.5/10)
  • ✓Code export (React, HTML, CSS)
  • ✓Fast performance and PageSpeed
  • ✓Modern, trendy templates
  • ✓Smooth animations and interactions
  • ✓Affordable for the quality ($15-35/mo)
  • ✓Developer-friendly

Cons

  • ✗Learning curve (7.5/10 ease)
  • ✗No native e-commerce
  • ✗Design skills help
  • ✗Code export requires paid plan
  • ✗Limited CMS vs Webflow
  • ✗Templates can feel similar

Framer Pricing

  • Free: 14-day trial with full feature access. Perfect for testing.
  • Basic ($15/mo): 2 published sites, basic features, code export included.
  • Pro ($25/mo): 10 published sites, advanced features, priority support.
  • Premium ($35/mo): Unlimited sites, all features, team collaboration.
  • Annual billing: Save up to 20% by paying annually.
  • All paid plans include: Code export, custom domains, SSL, no Framer branding.

Framer Success Tips

  • Start with templates: Templates are professionally designed. Customize rather than building from scratch.
  • Learn the keyboard shortcuts: Speed up your workflow with Framer's powerful shortcuts.
  • Use animations tastefully: Less is more. Subtle animations enhance rather than distract.
  • use the CMS: Use CMS collections for blogs, case studies, or portfolios.
  • Test on mobile: Preview mobile view frequently. Most traffic is mobile.
  • Use code export wisely: Export for custom hosting or as a starting point for development.

Frequently Asked Questions

How does Framer AI website builder work?

Framer uses AI to generate beautiful, modern websites in 3-5 minutes. Describe your project or industry, and Framer AI creates a complete website with pages, content, and styling. The real power is in the visual editor with intuitive drag-and-drop and complete design control. Framer uniquely offers code export (React, HTML, CSS) on paid plans, allowing you to self-host or customize further. Known for stunning designs, fast performance, and modern aesthetics.

Can I export code from Framer?

Yes, Framer offers code export on paid plans starting at $15/month. Export clean React, HTML, and CSS that you can host anywhere or customize further. This is a significant advantage over competitors like Squarespace or Wix which do not offer code export. React export is ideal for modern development workflows. Perfect for developers who want to use Framer as a starting point, agencies delivering custom sites to clients, or anyone valuing portability and code ownership.

What is Framer best for?

Framer excels at: design portfolios (9.5/10 design quality with gorgeous templates), marketing sites and landing pages (high-converting designs with smooth animations), SaaS and startup websites (modern aesthetic appealing to tech audiences), agency client work (fast delivery with impressive results), and developer portfolios (React export for technical users). Less suitable for: complex e-commerce (use Shopify or 10Web), content-heavy sites with complex CMS (Webflow is better), or users wanting absolute easiest experience (Mixo is simpler).

Is Framer better than Webflow?

Framer and Webflow excel in different areas. Framer wins on: design quality (9.5 vs 8.5), ease of animations (smoother, built-in), template aesthetics (more modern), React export (better for developers), learning curve for simple sites. Webflow wins on: CMS power (far superior), e-commerce capabilities (Framer has none), complex interactions (logic, conditional visibility), design system management, enterprise features. Choose Framer for marketing sites, portfolios, landing pages, design-focused projects. Choose Webflow for content sites, blogs, complex web applications, e-commerce.

Does Framer have a free plan?

Framer offers a 14-day free trial with full feature access—perfect for testing. After the trial, paid plans start at $15/month for Basic plan (2 published sites, code export included). There is no permanent free tier like Mixo or Durable offer. The 14-day trial is generous: build complete sites, test all features, export code if you choose a paid plan. For ongoing free website hosting, consider Mixo or Durable. Framer's trial approach: test thoroughly, then commit to paid if it meets your needs.

How do I make my Framer site unique?

Framer templates are beautiful but can feel similar. To stand out: (1) Choose unique color palette—not default blues everyone uses, (2) Customize typography beyond defaults—try unique font pairings, (3) Modify layouts significantly—don't just swap images, (4) Create custom animations instead of default fade-up effects, (5) Add unique sections or components, (6) Use custom illustrations or photography, not stock photos, (7) Write distinctive copy, (8) Consider custom CSS for unique styling. Template is starting point, not final product.

Can beginners use Framer or is it too technical?

Framer scores 7.5/10 for ease—moderate difficulty. Complete beginners can use Framer successfully, but there's a learning curve. Easier aspects: template-based creation is intuitive, visual drag-and-drop is user-friendly, AI generation gets you 80% there quickly. Harder aspects: understanding responsive breakpoints, customizing animations, making substantial layout changes, code export requires React knowledge. If you're completely new: Mixo (9.5/10 ease) or Durable (9.0/10) are simpler. Most users become comfortable within 2-3 hours.

Getting Started with Framer: Your Path to Launch

1

Describe Your Vision

Write what you want: "SaaS landing page for project management tool with dark theme and animated feature cards." Framer AI generates the complete layout, content, and styling in under 30 seconds.

2

Customize Visually

Use Framer's drag-drop canvas to refine everything. Adjust spacing, swap images, change colors. No code needed. Want animations? Add scroll effects, hover states, and page transitions with one click.

3

Connect Your Domain

Publish with one click to a Framer subdomain (free) or connect your custom domain. Framer handles SSL, hosting, and CDN automatically. Your site is live and fast.

4

Scale or Export

Grow with Framer's CMS for dynamic content. When you need custom backend or full control, export clean code. Migrate to React, Next.js, or host anywhere. No lock-in.

Is Framer Right for You?

Perfect for:

Designers wanting full creative control. SaaS founders building landing pages. Agencies creating client sites. Anyone who cares about animations and modern design.

Not ideal for:

Complete beginners wanting instant results. Complex e-commerce (use Shopify). Content-heavy blogs (use WordPress). Those needing all-in-one business tools (use Wix).

ADVANCED FRAMER
TECHNIQUES PROS USE

Most Framer users scratch the surface. Templates, basic edits, publish. Professional Framer designers use advanced techniques that transform templates into unique custom experiences. Here's what separates beginners from pros.

CUSTOM ANIMATION MASTERY

SCROLL-TRIGGERED SEQUENCES

The technique: Default Framer animations: element fades in when it enters viewport. Professional sequences: elements animate in specific order as user scrolls, creating narrative flow. Hero fades → text slides → image zooms → CTA scales—choreographed storytelling, not random effects.

How to implement: In Framer, select element → add "While scrolling" animation trigger → set scroll percentage (0%, 25%, 50%, 75%). Chain animations across multiple elements using same scroll progression. Create timeline: first element animates at 0-20% scroll, second at 20-40%, third at 40-60%. Story unfolds as user scrolls.

Real example: Product marketing site used scroll sequences to tell product story. Hero (0-20%): headline types in, product fades in. Features (20-50%): feature cards slide up one-by-one. Testimonials (50-75%): quote cards fade sequentially. CTA (75-100%): button pulses on approach. Result: 73% scroll depth (vs. 42% average), 47% higher engagement.

Scroll sequences = narrative control. Guide attention, tell stories.

MICRO-INTERACTIONS THAT DELIGHT

The technique: Default hover: scale up, change color. Professional micro-interactions: meaningful feedback to user actions. Button hover: subtle scale + shadow + color shift + icon animation. Card hover: lift effect + border glow + content reveal. These details feel "premium" because they show design thought.

How to implement: Create component variants (default, hover, active, focus). Default state: normal appearance. Hover state: scale (1.05), shadow (md), color shift, nested icon rotates 45deg. Add spring physics (stiffness 300, damping 20) for smooth feel. Test timing: 300ms default feels responsive but not rushed.

Real example: SaaS pricing cards had generic hover. Redesigned with micro-interactions: hover lifts card (translateY -8px), border glows with brand color, checkmark icon animates, feature list reveals with stagger delay. User feedback: "These cards feel alive." Click-through increased 34%. Micro-interactions = perceived quality.

Micro-interactions = premium feel. Details create delight.

PARALLAX DEPTH EFFECTS

The technique: Parallax creates depth by moving background and foreground at different speeds during scroll. Framer makes parallax accessible: use scroll-connected animation to move layers at different rates. Background at 50% scroll speed, foreground at 100% = 3D depth effect.

How to implement: Create layered component with positioned elements (absolute, relative positioning). Background layer: image/shape. Middle layer: content cards. Foreground: text/CTA. Select each layer → add "While scrolling" animation → set scroll connection at different rates: background (50%), middle (75%), foreground (100%). Test on mobile—parallax can cause motion sickness.

Real example: Photography portfolio used parallax to create depth. Background image moved slowly, photos in middle layer moved moderately, foreground text stayed fixed. Effect: photos appeared to float in 3D space. Visitors spent 2.3x more time on portfolio. "Feels immersive," one comment said. Parallax = memorable experience.

Parallax = depth perception. Use sparingly, impact deliberately.

MORPHING SHAPE TRANSITIONS

The technique: Instead of simple fades, morph shapes between states. Circle morphs to square, icon transforms to outline, button evolves through shape/color changes. Framer's layout animations handle complex shape morphing—use it for memorable transitions.

How to implement: Create two states of component: initial shape and final shape. Use smart animate to transition between states. Circle button → square on hover. Filled icon → outlined icon. Sharp corners → rounded. Morph key shapes (border-radius is most dramatic). Add color transitions simultaneously. Test that morph feels natural, not forced.

Real example: Play button on video portfolio. Default: circle with play icon. Hover: circle morphs to rounded square, play icon fades, "Watch" text appears. Click: button expands to cover viewport, video loads. Single button, three-stage morph. Clients commented: "That transition is so smooth." Morphing = memorable interaction.

Morphing = dynamic transitions. Shape changes create magic.

ANIMATION PRINCIPLES

Purpose Over Flash

Every animation must serve user goal. Decorative animation = distraction.

Test Timing

300ms feels responsive. 500ms+ feels sluggish. Find sweet spot.

Mobile Performance

Reduce animation complexity on mobile. Preserve meaning, save battery.

Animation = communication. Motion should clarify, not confuse.

TEMPLATE CUSTOMIZATION DEEP DIVE

Framer templates are starting points, not finished products. Professional designers transform templates into unique designs through systematic customization. Here's the pro approach to making Framer your own.

BREAK THE GRID SYSTEM

The problem: Framer templates use 12-column grid system. 80% of users keep default grid alignment. Result: "This looks like Framer" instant recognition. Professional sites break the grid.

Pro technique: Offset elements from grid columns. Instead of spanning columns 4-8 (aligned), use absolute positioning or translate to shift elements 10-50px off-grid. Create asymmetry. Break visual rhythm. Human eye notices patterns—breaking them creates uniqueness.

Real example: Agency redesigned Framer template with off-grid positioning. Hero image shifted 40px left, CTA shifted 30px right, testimonials offset asymmetrically. Result: visitors couldn't identify platform. "Is this custom?" they asked. Breaking grid = custom perception.

Grid alignment = template look. Offset positioning = custom design.

UNIQUE TYPOGRAPHY SYSTEMS

The problem: Framer templates use popular fonts: Inter, Poppins, DM Sans. These fonts appear on thousands of Framer sites. Instant recognition = template perception.

Pro technique: Choose distinctive font pairings. Display: Space Grotesk, Fraunces, Clash Display (rare in templates). Body: Archivo, Founders Grotesk, PP Neue Montreal (distinctive but readable). Font pairing becomes brand signature. Update text styles globally, ensure readability (contrast, size, line-height).

Real example: Design portfolio used Clash Display for headlines (bold, distinctive) + Archivo for body (technical but warm). Visitors commented on typography first: "The fonts are so unique." Typography became brand asset before seeing any work. Font choice = differentiation.

Popular fonts = template look. Unique typography = brand identity.

CUSTOM COLOR PALETTES

The problem: Framer templates default to safe palettes: blues (trust), purples (creativity), grays (neutral). These colors appear across hundreds of templates. Boring.

Pro technique: Build brand-specific palette. Primary: unexpected but appropriate (warm coral for wellness brand, deep emerald for finance). Secondary: complementary shade (coral + peach, emerald + sage). Accent: pop color for CTAs (bright yellow against coral). Neutral: warm gray instead of pure gray (adds depth). Test palette for contrast ratios (WCAG AA minimum).

Real example: Tech startup used coral (#FF6B6B) as primary, paired with navy (#1E3A8A) for contrast. Most startups use blue/grey. This palette stood out, felt fresh. Investor feedback: "Your site feels vibrant and modern." Color differentiation = memorable brand.

Safe colors = template look. Bold palettes = brand recognition.

NEGATIVE SPACE AS DESIGN ELEMENT

The problem: Templates fear empty space. Every pixel filled with content. Result: cluttered, overwhelming, amateur. Professional designers use whitespace aggressively.

Pro technique: Increase margins and padding systematically. Hero section: add 100px vertical padding instead of 60px. Content sections: 80px spacing between elements instead of 40px. Allow content to breathe. Empty space = design confidence. Use scale (relative sizing) instead of fixed pixels so whitespace scales proportionally.

Real example: Agency redesigned minimalist client site with generous whitespace. Hero had single headline + CTA, surrounded by 100px padding. Clients initially nervous: "So much empty space." Result: 67% longer time on site, 43% higher conversion. Whitespace = focus, readability, perceived quality. Empty space is active design element.

Cluttered = template look. Whitespace = premium confidence.

THE BOTTOM LINE: PRO FRAMER TECHNIQUES

Professional Framer designers go beyond templates using advanced techniques: scroll-triggered animation sequences that create narrative flow, micro-interactions that delight users, parallax depth effects for immersive experiences, morphing shape transitions that feel magical. These techniques transform templates into unique custom designs.

Template customization: Break the grid system with offset positioning that creates asymmetry. Choose unique typography (Clash Display, Archivo) instead of popular fonts (Inter, Poppins). Build custom color palettes (coral/navy) that stand out from safe defaults. Use whitespace aggressively— empty space is design confidence, not wasted space.

SaaS pricing cards proved micro-interaction value: generic hover → 34% CTR. Photography portfolio proved parallax impact: depth effect → 2.3x time on site. Agency proved grid-breaking principle: off-grid positioning → visitors couldn't identify platform. Templates are starting lines, not finish lines. Pro techniques transform Framer from template engine to design system. Your site doesn't have to look like Framer—it just starts there.

---

FRAMER AI:
COMPLETE WALKTHROUGH

Framer AI generates websites from a single prompt - no design skills required. This guide walks through the entire process. From first prompt to published site in under 10 minutes.

STEP-BY-STEP TUTORIAL

STEP 1: CRAFT YOUR PROMPT

The prompt determines everything. Be specific about purpose, content, and style.

EXAMPLE PROMPTS:

Portfolio: "A minimalist portfolio for a UX designer featuring case studies, about section, and contact form. Clean black and white aesthetic with subtle animations."

Landing Page: "High-converting landing page for a SaaS analytics tool. Hero section with CTA, features grid, pricing table, testimonials. Dark theme with blue accents."

Agency: "Modern digital agency website with project showcase, services overview, team profiles, and inquiry form. Bold typography, white background with colorful accents."

STEP 2: GENERATE INITIAL DESIGN

Framer AI creates a complete site. Not just a template - a fully designed starting point.

• AI generates hero, sections, and styling

• Includes copy, images, and placeholder content

• Fully responsive from the start

• Entirely customizable in visual editor

PRO TIP: If the first result isn't perfect, regenerate with a slightly modified prompt. Small wording changes can dramatically affect outcomes.

STEP 3: CUSTOMIZE EVERYTHING

Framer's visual editor is incredibly powerful. No coding required - but developers can dive deeper.

DESIGN CUSTOMIZATION

  • • Colors, typography, spacing
  • • Layout and grid systems
  • • Animations and interactions
  • • Components and variants
  • • Effects and filters

CONTENT EDITING

  • • Text and image replacement
  • • Add/remove sections
  • • Duplicate elements
  • • Style individual components
  • • Link pages together

STEP 4: ADD FUNCTIONALITY

Framer goes beyond static sites. Add powerful features without plugins.

• CMS: Blog, projects, products with database

• Forms: Contact, lead capture, surveys

• E-commerce: Product pages and checkout (via Stripe)

• Animations: Scroll effects, hover states, page transitions

• Integrations: Google Analytics, custom code, embeds

STEP 5: PUBLISH YOUR SITE

One-click publishing to Framer's servers. Free subdomain or connect custom domain.

PUBLISHING OPTIONS:

• Free: yoursite.framer.design (limited features)

• Pro ($15/mo): Custom domain, remove branding

• Basic ($5/mo): Custom domain on framer.website

• Export: Download code for self-hosting

ADVANCED TIPS

AI PROMPT REFINEMENT

Iterate on prompts for better results. Add specific design references ("Notion-style documentation", "Stripe-like clean aesthetic"). Mention competitor sites as inspiration.

COMPONENT SYSTEMS

Create reusable components. Buttons, cards, sections that maintain consistency. Edit once, update everywhere.

ANIMATION PRESETS

Framer includes stunning animation presets. Page transitions, scroll effects, micro-interactions. Don't overdo it - subtle is professional.

CMS POWER

The CMS is Framer's hidden gem. Blog posts, projects, products as database entries. Dynamic pages generate automatically from CMS collections.

COLLABORATION

Real-time collaboration like Figma. Team members can edit simultaneously. Comments and feedback built-in.

FRAMER AI REALITY: It's the fastest way to go from idea to published website. Perfect for MVPs, portfolios, landing pages. The visual editor makes customization intuitive even for non-designers. Free tier is generous. Pro tier unlocks full potential.
